_header: Lord that art of mights most
Subjects: Trinity, prayers to; prayers, to Trinity
_description: A prayer to the Trinity — two 6-line stanzas (aabccb)

CULIi643.First Lines:
LOrde þat art of myȝtis moostffadir & sone &
                    holygoost…
CULIi643.Last Lines: …The to see face to faceWorlde with outen ende
CULIi643.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Popular Prayers in Middle English Verse.” 
             Modern Philology
         36 (1939): 337-50: 339.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 79.

PlimptonAd2.First Lines:
Lord that art of miȝtis mosteffad[ir] and son & holy
                    gost…
PlimptonAd2.Last Lines:
…In heuene blys þu ȝif me graceThe to see face to
                    faceWorlord wiþ owte ende
PlimptonAd2.Note:
Followed by another devotional poem (430), unpublished, ‘Almytty god Iehu crist
                    þat deydest upon de rode tre’.
